home.title: Idea War Room
home.subtitle: AI-powered Idea Analysis and Validation
home.authRequired: Authentication is required via our main platform.

dashboard.title: Idea War Room
dashboard.subtitle: AI-powered Idea Analysis and Validation
dashboard.welcomeDesc: Ready to stress-test your startup idea? Start a new analysis session to get evidence-backed adversarial insights in 10-15 minutes.

intake.step1Desc: Let's start with the essentials. Describe your idea in a clear and concise way.
intake.step2Desc: Help us understand your target market and competitive landscape.
intake.step3Desc: Key assumptions and strengths that shape your strategy. Skip any that don't apply.
intake.highConceptLabel: Describe your idea in one sentence
intake.highConceptPlaceholder: A platform that helps solo founders validate startup ideas through AI-powered adversarial analysis
intake.valuePropositionLabel: What problem does this solve, and for whom?
intake.valuePropositionPlaceholder: Founders spend weeks gathering feedback, only to realize critical flaws too late. We help solo founders and early-stage entrepreneurs identify risks before investing time and money.
intake.successMetricLabel: What does success look like in 18 months? (Be specific and measurable)
intake.successMetricPlaceholder: 10,000 validated ideas with 70% accuracy on risk prediction
intake.userPersonaPlaceholder: Solo founders and early-stage entrepreneurs (25-45 years old) who are technical enough to understand product development but lack market validation experience
intake.competitiveLandscapePlaceholder: Similar tools: ProductHunt validation, BetaList feedback, Reddit communities. None combine automated research with adversarial analysis.
intake.regulatoryContextLabel: Regulatory Context (Leave blank if not applicable)
intake.regulatoryContextPlaceholder: Describe relevant regulations (GDPR, financial services, healthcare, etc.) if applicable
intake.marketAssumptionsHelper: What are your key assumptions about the target market?
intake.marketAssumptionsPlaceholder: e.g., Solo founders spend 2 hours/day gathering feedback
intake.technicalAssumptionsHelper: What technical capabilities or feasibility are you assuming?
intake.technicalAssumptionsPlaceholder: e.g., LLMs can accurately analyze startup ideas
intake.businessModelAssumptionsHelper: Assumptions about pricing, distribution, or revenue?
intake.businessModelAssumptionsPlaceholder: e.g., Users will pay $20/month for validation tools
intake.keyAssetsHelper: What unique advantages do you have? (Skills, IP, distribution channels, partnerships)
intake.keyAssetsPlaceholder: e.g., 10 years of experience in AI/ML
intake.brandNarrativeHelper: What compelling stories or brand elements do you have?
intake.brandNarrativePlaceholder: e.g., Founded by Y Combinator alumni
intake.noItemsYet: No items added yet. Click the button below to add one.
intake.tipContent: While these fields are optional, providing more detail helps our AI generate a more thorough adversarial analysis.
intake.noIdeaYet: No idea yet? Explore with a sample:

choice.title: Choose Your Next Step
choice.subtitle: Your idea has been saved. Select how you'd like to proceed.
choice.mvtaDesc: Using the MVTA method, simulate adversarial attacks on your idea across 5 threat vectors. Get 15-25 vulnerabilities with severity scores and actionable recommendations.
choice.researchDesc: Choose from competitor analysis, community voice research, or regulatory compliance. Run one or all three types independently.
choice.recommendedHint: Recommended: Run analysis with your research insights
choice.coreFeatureHint: Core feature: Identify vulnerabilities before building
choice.viewMoreResearch: View or run additional research types
choice.continueResearchHint: Some research completed, continue with remaining types
choice.optionalResearchHint: Optional: Research can be done before or after MVTA

research.title: Online Research
research.subtitle: Select the type of research you want to conduct for your idea. You can run multiple types independently.
howItWorksDesc: Click on a research type to start gathering intelligence
Each research type runs independently (2-5 minutes each)
You can run one, two, or all three types for your idea
Once completed, click again to view results
research.typeNotRecognized: The research type "{type}" is not recognized.
research.researchFailedDesc: The research process completed but no results were generated. This might be due to an API error or rate limiting.
research.noResultsForType: No results found for this research type.
research.mvpNoteContent: This is a simplified version. Full version will show real-time progress updates and display detailed research cards as results arrive.
research.invalidTypeMessage: Please select a valid research type from the research types page.

competitor.label: Competitor Research
competitor.description: Discover competitor products, pricing strategies, and market positioning.

community.label: Community Voice
community.description: Uncover user pain points, feedback, and discussions from online communities.
community.shortDesc: Listen to user discussions and feedback

regulatory.label: Regulatory Research
regulatory.description: Identify compliance requirements and legal considerations.

analysis.title: Red Team Analysis
analysis.subtitle: Running red team analysis - MVTA on your idea...
analysis.analyzingIdea: Analyzing your idea across 5 threat vectors...
analysis.mvtaStep1: 1. Technical Penetration Tester - attacking product integrity...
analysis.mvpNoteContent: This is a simplified loading screen. Full version will show real-time attack simulation progress with animated visuals.

quota.upgradeMessage: Upgrade your membership to create more sessions.

errors.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.
errors.validationFailed: Validation failed. Please check your input.
